line: Home isn’t where you land; home is where you launch. You can’t pick your home any more than you can choose your family. In poker, you get five cards. Three of them you can swap out, but two are yours to keep: family and native land.
author: Tayari Jones

line: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
author: Yann Martel

line: The gods grow jealous of too much contentment anywhere, and they show their displeasure all of a sudden.
author: R. K. Narayan

line: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life
author: F Scott Fitzgerald

line: So I'll do that, and I'll do my best and if my best isn't good enough, at least I will have done everything I could, everything that is in me. I don't have to try to be someone else, someone I could never be.
author: Garth Nix

line: A mind needs books like a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.
book: A Game of Thrones: A Song of Ice and Fire
author: George R. R. Martin

line: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Anna Todd

line: For the two of us, home isn't a place. It is a person. And we are finally home.
author: Stephanie Perkins

line: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone
author: J.K. Rowling

line: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
author: William Shakespeare

line: It moves at its own measured pace, for it has no reason to hurry. Tomorrow will come in its own good time.
author: Sidney Sheldon

line: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
author: Dan Brown

line: You do not have to struggle to reach God, but you do have to struggle to tear away the self-created veil that hides him from you
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

line: Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.
book: A Song of Ice and Fire
author: George R.R. Martin

line: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkein

line: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library.
author: Jane Austen

line: Tomorrow I’ll think of some way to get him back. After all, tomorrow is another day.
author: Gone with the Wind

line: Why, sometimes, I’ve believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
author: Through the Looking-Glass

line: Don’t ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody.
author: The Catcher in the Rye

line: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone

line: You pierce my soul. I am half agony. Half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever.
author: Persuasion

line: I had the epiphany that laughter was light, and light was laughter, and that this was the secret of the universe.
author: The Goldfinch

line: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
author: The Song of the Lark

line: When you play the game of thrones you win or you die.
author: A Game of Thrones

line: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
author: A Farewell to Arms

line: From that time on, the world was hers for the reading. She would never be lonely again, never miss the lack of intimate friends. Books became her friends and there was one for every mood.
author: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

line: Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering.
author: The History of Love

line: Anyone who ever gave you confidence, you owe them a lot.
author: Breakfast at Tiffany’s

line: Isn’t it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?
author: Anne of Green Gables

line: Call me Ishmael.
author: Moby Dick

line: The past is not dead. In fact, it’s not even past.
author: Requiem for a Nun

line: He has put a knife on the things that held us together and we have fallen apart.
author: Things Fall Apart

line: Brave doesn’t mean you’re not scared. It means you go on even though you’re scared.
author: Angie Thomas

line: Great dreamers' dreams are never fulfilled, they are always transcended.
book: The Monk who sold his Ferrari
author: Alfred Lord Whitehead

line: Stupidity is one of the two things we see most clearly in retrospect. The other is missed chances.
author: Stephen King

line: Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book.
author: John Green

line: If you don't understand, ask questions. If you're uncomfortable about asking questions, say you are uncomfortable about asking questions and then ask anyway.
author: Ngozi Adichie

line: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.
author: George Orwell

line: The great thing about this life of ours is that you can be someone different to everybody.
author: Jennifer Niven

line: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
author: J.M. Barrie

line: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
book: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
author: J.K. Rowling

line: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Bronte

line: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship
author: Louisa May Alcott

line: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

line: There is some good in this world and it’s worth fighting for.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

line: Real courage is when you know you’re licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee

line: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Brontë

line: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

line: Be yourself and people will like you.
author: Jeff Kinney

line: The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.
author: Ashley Ross

line: Sitting around miserable all day won't make you any happier.
book: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
author: John Boyne

line: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
author: Charles Dickens

line: I don't understand it any more than you do, but one thing I've learned is that you don't have to understand things for them to be.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

line: There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name.
author: Kate DiCamillo

line: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
author: Paulo Coelho
